definition: grasping officials, corrupt mandarins (idiom); abuse and corruption
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt

sentences.english: The money was all pocketed by corrupt officials.
sentences.chinese: 這些錢都進了貪官污吏的腰包。

sentences.english: I don't intimidate the public, I only intimidate those corrupt officials.
sentences.chinese: 我從來不嚇唬老百姓，只嚇唬那些貪官污吏。

sentences.english: The corrupt officials tried to sidetrack our investigation.
sentences.chinese: 這些貪官污吏企圖岔開我們的調查。

sentences.english: There are a lot of corrupt officials in the government.
sentences.chinese: 政府中的貪官污吏大有人在。

sentences.english: Although it had many corrupt officials, the Kuomintang managed enterprises better than we do.
sentences.chinese: 國民黨貪官污吏多得很，但是辦企業比我們好。

sentences.english: The crime of the corrupt officials must be exposed without any reserve.
sentences.chinese: 這些貪官污吏所犯下的罪行必需毫無保存的被揭露。

sentences.english: Should eliminate these corrupt officials thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 是該徹底清除這些貪官污吏了。

sentences.english: Toleration of dishonest officials encourages corruption.
sentences.chinese: 對貪官污吏的姑息遷就就是助長腐敗。

sentences.english: Corrupt officials in old China used to capitalize on naturalcalamities.
sentences.chinese: 舊中國的貪官污吏往往利用自然災害大發橫財。

sentences.english: Of moral decay and corrupt officials, even you were not to look at.
sentences.chinese: 對道德敗壞者和貪官污吏，連看也不要看。

sentences.english: They acted in collusion with corrupt officials.
sentences.chinese: 他們與貪官污吏狼狽爲奸。

sentences.english: Those corrupt officials fattened themselves by drinking the people's life-blood.
sentences.chinese: 那些貪官污吏用民脂民膏養肥了自己。

sentences.english: FOR corrupt officials in central and eastern Europe, life has seldom been better.
sentences.chinese: 在存在貪官污吏的中歐和東歐，生活並不好過。

sentences.english: The peasants staged an uprising against the corrupt officials.
sentences.chinese: 農民起義反對貪官污吏。
